questions.question: Which UNESCO site in South America is renowned as a lost city of the Incas and rediscovered in 1911?
questions.context: Situated on a mountain ridge above the Sacred Valley, it is one of the most familiar symbols of Inca civilization.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in the Middle East is famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system?
questions.context: This archaeological city, dating back to the 4th century BC, was the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom.

questions.question: Which iconic UNESCO site in Asia was originally constructed in the 7th century and later expanded to become the largest religious monument in the world?
questions.context: Built initially as a Hindu temple dedicated to Vishnu, it later transformed into a Buddhist temple in the late 12th century.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Europe is known for its cave paintings, estimated to be more than 17,000 years old?
questions.context: Discovered in 1940, this site contains some of the best-known Upper Paleolithic art.

questions.question: Which UNESCO site in the heart of Africa is famed for its vast array of unique wildlife and crater landscape?
questions.context: Formed millions of years ago from a large volcanic explosion, this site is a haven for elephants, lions, and the black rhino.
